p: Inflammation is the immediate body's defense against infection or trauma injury; however, it can be considered a double-edged sword. Inflammation with activation of both innate and adaptive immune responses can enhance host immunity against infection, while excessive immune responses following some pathogens such as the influenza virus, trigger life-threatening CSS in the host, which can result in excessive production of pro-inflammatory cytokines and eventually, leads to death ( 15, 16). Cytokines are a group of secreted proteins that are released by some cells with specific effects on the development, differentiation, and regulation of immune cells ( 17).
